Tank Monitors

Tank monitors make it possible for us to view fuel levels remotely and can be installed on any tank as an added layer of protection to ensure your deliveries are always timed flawlessly.

Fuel Quality

Since fuel deliveries are our area of expertise, we ensure that we supply our clients with premium quality fuel. Low quality fuel can bring about equipment problems that affect your operations and your profitability. We add ECOPro to each and every diesel delivery as a means to protect and also enhance your fuel supply. ECOPro contains properties that will protect your fuel supply. Furthermore, it will enable your valuable equipment to perform better and have a longer lifespan.

Water dispersant – prevents condensation and bacteria from building inside your tanks.

Detergent – removes and prevents engine and tank deposits that can harm equipment.

Corrosion inhibitor – protects costly fuel systems and injectors from rust and corrosion.

Lubricity agent – improves fuel economy and helps slow the process of normal wear-and-tear.

Cetane improver – helps with cold-starts and improves fuel economy.

Anti-gel agent – added seasonally to prevent fuel from gelling in the winter.

ECOPro is included in every Tevis Energy diesel delivery we make!

Common Commerical Fueling Problems That We Solve All Of The Time:

Wasted Time Refueling At Diesel and Gasoline Stations Near Scotland

When commercial companies do not have a strategy for refueling equipment and vehicles on-site, they experience the impact of wasted employee hours. When an employee has to go out of their way to fill up, it takes a lot of time. They need to drive to the fill station, fill the vehicle, and drive back to the facility. To avoid this, you can either choose on-site fueling tanks or Tevis Energy’s fleet fueling options.

Higher Risk of Fueling Accidents When Refueling Vehicles at a Retail Pump Station

The risk of a collision is highly possible when driving to the fill station, leading to a significant cost to the company. When a collision takes place, the insurance provider may send out a poor insurance rating. One of the absolute best ways to avoid this problem is to use Tevis Energy’s on-site fueling services or our fleet fueling solutions.

Risk Of Running Out Of Fuel in Scotland

No business wants to have reduced productivity and downtime as a result of running out of fuel. This can possibly be a huge financial impact and could be easily avoided. Our solution is to install tank monitors. A Tevis Energy type monitoring system signals our office when your tank(s) is reaching a critical level to be refueled.

Water Contaminating Fuel Systems

When you use either construction, manufacturing, farming, or even industrial equipment, it runs hot from working hard throughout the day. As a consequence, when you are finished working with your equipment, you shut it down and it starts to cool. This results in the development of condensation, which can wreak havoc on your equipment. This condensation leads to corroded lines and also injectors. It plugs filters and creates the ideal environment for the development of bacteria. This produces a situation of sludge in your fuel system.

Our remedy is EcoPro Fuel Additive. This decreases water accumulated by condensation and it reduces corrosion and/or sludge formation.

Sludge and/or Corrosion in Diesel Fuel Systems

Unfortunately, fuel systems that are contaminated result in lost productivity, downtime, and also an increase in equipment repair work and maintenance. As in the case of water contamination, our approach to handling sludge and corrosion issues in your diesel equipment is EcoPro Fuel Additive.

Diesel Fuel Gelling in Scotland’s Cold Weather

When temperature levels are low, the wax molecules, found in diesel fuel, can gather to form a gel-like substance. When this occurs, it leads to downtime and even more equipment expenditure. To avoid gelling, you can utilize EcoPlus Fuel Additive.

Poor Control of Fuel Dispensing in Scotland

Without a supervised, on-site fuel solution or a fleet fueling solution, businesses encounter fuel loss as a result of employee theft. Also, companies tend to spend more in taxes when they utilize on-road diesel for their off-road vehicles. In addition, accounting and tracking is far more difficult to deal with.
